block.p: Eileen Patricia Grady and Andrew Riker Vermilye were married yesterday by Elizabeth O. Parker, a nondenominational minister, at the Chevy Chase (Md.) Club.

Ms. Grady, 36, is keeping her name. She is an employee-assistance program administrator at the Justice Department in Washington. She graduated and received a master's degree in social work from the Catholic University of America. She is a daughter of Hilda and William E. Grady of Hamden, Conn. Her father is the chief executive of Ansonia Copper and Brass, a manufacturer in Ansonia, Conn. Her mother, who is retired, was a nurse at Hamden Health Care, a nursing home.
Eileen Patricia Grady and Andrew Riker Vermilye were married yesterday by Elizabeth O. Parker, a nondenominational minister, at the Chevy Chase (Md.) Club.

Ms. Grady, 36, is keeping her name. She is an employee-assistance program administrator at the Justice Department in Washington. She graduated and received a master's degree in social work from the Catholic University of America. She is a daughter of Hilda and William E. Grady of Hamden, Conn. Her father is the chief executive of Ansonia Copper and Brass, a manufacturer in Ansonia, Conn. Her mother, who is retired, was a nurse at Hamden Health Care, a nursing home.

Mr. Vermilye, 44, is the senior policy adviser in Washington to Senator John J. Breaux, Democrat of Louisiana. He graduated from Trinity College in Hartford. He is a son of Lucy and Peter H. Vermilye of Manchester, Mass. His father, who retired as the chief investment officer at Citicorp in New York, is a senior adviser to the Harbor Capital Management Company in Boston.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
